term.title: Cox–Yates equation

item.text: A modification of the Bunnett–Olsen equation of the form: log10([SH+]/[S]) - log10[H+] = m*.X + pKSH+ is called the excess acidity because it gives a measure of the difference between the acidity of a solution and that of an ideal solution of the same concentration. In practice and .
